    Ani Kembhavi

    Computer Vision Researcher

    • Seattle, WA
    • Email
    • Website
    • Google Scholar
    I am a senior research scientist in the Perceptual Reasoning and Interaction Research (PRIOR) team at the Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence (AI2) in sunny Seattle. Prior to AI2, I spent five years at Microsoft Bing, building large scale machine learning systems in the Image & Video Search Relevance team.

    I grew up in Pune, India where I obtained by Bachelors in Engineering at the College Of Engineering Pune (COEP). I got my Ph.D. at the University of Maryand, College Park under the supervision of Prof. Larry S. Davis.

    I am interested in research problems at the intersection of vision and language including collaboration via communication and learning from interaction.

    Jul 2018 Our work on generating Flintstones animations has been accepted to ECCV 2018. [Details]
    Jun 2018 Our work on IQA: Visual Question Answering in Interactive Environments has received the NVIDIA Pioneer Award. [Details]
